bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3372) to authorize implementation grants to community-based nonprofits to operate one-stop reentry centers; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6878) to address the health needs of incarcerated women related to pregnancy and childbirth,and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8876) to reauthorize the Maternal, Infant, and Early Childhood Home Visiting program, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 100) to provide for a resolution with respect to the unresolved disputes between certain railroads represented by the National Carriers' Conference Committee of the National Railway Labor Conference and certain of their employees; and for other purposes.
bill.description: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3372) to authorize implementation grants to community-based nonprofits to operate one-stop reentry centers; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6878) to address the health needs of incarcerated women related to pregnancy and childbirth,and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8876) to reauthorize the Maternal, Infant, and Early Childhood Home Visiting program, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 100) to provide for a resolution with respect to the unresolved disputes between certain railroads represented by the National Carriers' Conference Committee of the National Railway Labor Conference and certain of their employees; and for other purposes.

history.action: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-587, by Mr. McGovern.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 153.
The resolution provides for adoption of H. Res. 1495 and H. Con. Res. 118.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H8652-8660)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1499.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216 - 202 (Roll no. 489). (text: CR H8653)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
